Welcome to my personal page

I am researcher at the BCAM-Basque Center for Applied Mathematics and research leader of the Applied Statistics Group.

I obtained my PhD. in Statistics at Universidad Carlos III de Madrid, previously I was Postdoctoral Researcher at CSIRO Mathematics, Informatics and Statistics division (old CMIS) now Digital Productivity Flagship in Melbourne VIC Australia (from February 2011 to February 2014).

Research interests

My research interest lies in non-parametric smoothing methods for complex data. Particularly I'm studying smoothing techniques based on penalized splines regression models (Penalized Likelihood splines with B-splines basis) in mixed models framework ("Generalized Linear Mixed Models", GLMM's). My advisor was Dr. María Durbán.

I am also member of the Statistical Modelling Society since July 2006 and since 2016 I am member of the board of the Spanish Biometric Society.

The main applications of my work are related to:

  • Multidimensional smoothing
  • Spatial and spatio-temporal statistics
  • Computational Statistics
  • Disease mapping and epidemiology
  • Mortality Life Tables
  • Forecasting with P-splines
  • Environmental modelling
  • Functional Data Analysis
  • Wireless Sensors and Sensor Networks
  • Health Related Quality of Life
  • Complex data visualization

Students

PhD. students

  • Diego Ayma Anza (uc3m), PhD candidate (expected late 2016). Topic: "Penalized Composite Link Models for spatial and spatio-temporal aggregated counts" (with M. Durbán).
  • Josu Nájera Zuloaga (BCAM-Severo Ochoa), PhD candidate (expected 2018). Topic: "Multidimensional and longitudinal Beta-binomial regression for Health Related Quality of Life outcomes" (with I. Arostegui).
  • Alba Carballo González (uc3m), PhD candidate (expected 2018). Topic: "Forecasting with Generalized Additive Models" (with M. Durbán).

Msc. students

  • Andreu Jiménez (BCAM-Università de Valencia), Msc. in Biostatistics (July 2015). Topic: "Statistical modelling of Health Related Quality of Life measures for Colorectal Cancer with beta-binomial and quantile regression approaches".

Internship Programme students

  • Gorka Kobeaga (BCAM-Internship Programme). Project title: "Open Source Tool for Traffic Incidents Analytics in the Basque Country". Visit project at OpenTraffic
  • Gökberk Ozsakalli (BCAM-DOC Course IMUS Programme) from Yasar University (Turkey). Project title: "A benchmark study of algorithms for face recognition".
